I would recommend "Waterworld" for those who enjoy post-apocalyptic films. The movie follows a mutated mariner as he fights starvation and outlaws "smokers," and reluctantly helps a woman and a young girl try to find dry land.
"Mama" is another great option for those who enjoy post-apocalyptic films. The movie follows a young girl as she tries to survive a domestic violence attack, and eventually becomes the only trained instructor for women and children who have been victims of bullying and abuse just like her.
"The Skull" is also worth considering for those who enjoy post-apocalyptic films. The movie follows a mysterious reptilian foe as it attempts to destroy the city and all its inhabitants.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend watching "Hitch" (2005). It is a comedy film directed by Robert Zemeckis and starring Adam Sandler, Jennifer Aniston, David Spade, Alan Silberberg, and蔡明.

The plot of "Hitch" revolves around the romantic life of Andy Weir's character, Roy "Hitch" Hitchcock Jr. (Adam Sandler), who lives in Los Angeles with his girlfriend, Diane (Jennifer Aniston)).

In order to make his romantic dreams come true, Hitch must win over the hearts of two young and naive women: Rachel (Selena Gomez)) and Jessica (Kendall Jenner)).

As Hitch navigates through various obstacles and challenges during his quest to win back the hearts of Rachel and Jessica, he learns valuable lessons about love, friendship, and relationships.

The plot revolves around two lovers whose romance is threatened by the difference in their respective social classes. The story is told through the eyes of a young orphan boy who lives in a post-apocalyptic world.
In the second movie, "Six-String Samurai," a rock  'n' roll samurai on his way to Lost Vegas takes a young orphan boy under his protection as Death and his metalhead Horsemen chase after them. The plot revolves around two lovers whose romance is threatened by the difference in their respective social classes. The story is told through the eyes of a young orphan boy who lives in a post-apocalyptic world.
